commit_message:
Add DataPoint/DataFrame objects

This introduce the DataPoint and DataFrame objects. These are replacing the
dicts that were used until now:

A DataPoint is an immutable object representing one measure for one metric,
with associated price, qty, groupby and metadata.

A DataFrame is a collection of DataPoints, with helper functions for
point insertion and JSON formatting/loading.

Story: 2005890
Task: 35658
Change-Id: I71e95bba0a0cdd049b0fba3e79c7675b6365c37f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/65/674565/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - | Data frames/points are now internally represented as objects rather than dicts.

commit_message:
Disable gpg check in fedora:rawhide image

The heat-container-agent is currently failing to build due to misconfigured
upstream fedora:rawhide image. We can revert this change later.

Change-Id: I66723ae4329985c84a4549e44a4a7624927b3045
Story: 2006381
Task: 36184

commit_message:
Add fluentd_binary and fluentd_version labels

In order to orchestrate a smooth migration of fluentd to newer
td-agent on CentOS x86_64, a label that points to fluentd binary
and version are needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677144/
Change-Id: Ie2257870d87c5b3a9b0572f8fd35085a3f95fedb

added_lines: {% if base_package_type == 'rpm' %} LABEL fluentd-version="0.12" fluentd-binary="fluentd" {% else %} LABEL fluentd-version="0.14" fluentd-binary="td-agent" {% endif %}

Move final bridge commands to privsep.

A small number of remaining stragglers.

commit_message:
migration: Use python3 packages when needed

The patch changes names of installed packages by yum module based on
what Python version of interpreter is available on given node.

Closes-bug: #1839834

Change-Id: I5a2409d80ebd19904909bd62fb7c11ae0cbfde30

commit_message:
Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE is upstream EOL, let's remove the experimental job completely
so that we can remove 42.3 from CI.

Note that master uses a newer openSUSE 15 job but I don't want to add
support for new OS in a stable branch.

Change-Id: Ifc6b07eaff4922976e18393b9e7557193f461185

commit_message:
Update packages in virtualenvs

Kayobe uses a number of virtual environments on the remote hosts for
python dependencies such as shade, python-openstackclient, docker, etc.
By default these are stored in /opt/kayobe/venvs/. Typically we do not
provide version restrictions when installing these packages, so over the
course of time they may become stale and incompatible.

This change installs the latest version of packages allowed by OpenStack
upper constraints.

It also adds a new variable, 'pip_upper_constraints_file', to set the
upper constraints file. The existing variable
'kolla_upper_constraints_file' now defaults to the value of
'pip_upper_constraints_file'.

Change-Id: I8d2956f95bbc44b5a9e88e7569372048a62f12f5
Story: 2005923
Task: 34193

Change-Id: I4bb59edd87336597791416c4f2a096efe0e72fe3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-08 17:06:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/3ce2c45ed6c6331a0ae9de9649eead71dda2a80c', 'message': 'py3: Finish porting s3 func tests

We were (indirectly) importing swiftclient (and therefore requests and
urllib3) before doing our eventlet monkey-patching. This would lead
boto3 (which digs an SSLContext out of urllib3) to trip RecursionErrors
on py3 similar to

   >>> from ssl import SSLContext, PROTOCOL_SSLv23
   >>> import eventlet
   >>> eventlet.monkey_patch(socket=True)
   >>> SSLContext(PROTOCOL_SSLv23).options |= 0
   Traceback (most recent call last):
     File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
     File "/usr/lib/python3.6/ssl.py", line 465, in options
       super(SSLContext, SSLContext).options.__set__(self, value)
     File "/usr/lib/python3.6/ssl.py", line 465, in options
       super(SSLContext, SSLContext).options.__set__(self, value)
     File "/usr/lib/python3.6/ssl.py", line 465, in options
       super(SSLContext, SSLContext).options.__set__(self, value)
     [Previous line repeated 330 more times]
   RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object

Change-Id: I4bb59edd87336597791416c4f2a096efe0e72fe3

boto3 (which digs an SSLContext out of urllib3) to trip RecursionErrors
on py3 similar to

   >>> from ssl import SSLContext, PROTOCOL_SSLv23
   >>> import eventlet
   >>> eventlet.monkey_patch(socket=True)
   >>> SSLContext(PROTOCOL_SSLv23).options |= 0
   Traceback (most recent call last):

commit_message:
py3: Finish porting func tests

We were (indirectly) importing swiftclient (and therefore requests and
urllib3) before doing our eventlet monkey-patching. This would lead
boto3 (which digs an SSLContext out of urllib3) to trip RecursionErrors
on py3 similar to

   >>> from ssl import SSLContext, PROTOCOL_SSLv23
   >>> import eventlet
   >>> eventlet.monkey_patch(socket=True)
   >>> SSLContext(PROTOCOL_SSLv23).options |= 0
   Traceback (most recent call last):
     File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
     File "/usr/lib/python3.6/ssl.py", line 465, in options
       super(SSLContext, SSLContext).options.__set__(self, value)
     File "/usr/lib/python3.6/ssl.py", line 465, in options
       super(SSLContext, SSLContext).options.__set__(self, value)
     File "/usr/lib/python3.6/ssl.py", line 465, in options
       super(SSLContext, SSLContext).options.__set__(self, value)
     [Previous line repeated 330 more times]
   RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object

Change-Id: I4bb59edd87336597791416c4f2a096efe0e72fe3

commit_message:
Fix inspector iPXE boot with UEFI compute nodes

The IPA ramdisk fails to boot on UEFI compute nodes with iPXE. We see
the following error on the console, followed by a kernel panic:

Fix kernel panic-not syncing: VFS: unable to mount root fs on unknown
block(0,0)

The cause is the lack of an initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs kernel
argument in inspector.ipxe.

The initrd argument is present in the kolla-ansible version of
inspector.ipxe, and now contains all parameters that we need (since
Rocky), so this change simply removes our custom template, and passes
through the extra kernel argument option configuration value.

Story: 2006214
Task: 35804

Story: 2006213
Task: 35803

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/670566
Change-Id: I8a103b7c6d3dd1f0433f922ae90deae9b92c0c78

commit_message:
python-cyborgclient 0.4.0

Master branch for this library was not released since February.
Libraries should be regularly released to make their new features
available to consumers.

This change was generated semi-automatically. If there is a good reason
to hold on releasing this (like if you are waiting for a specific
feature or bugfix to land before releasing), please -1 this.

subject: We no longer need rootwrap.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-20 07:45:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6b56fad0cf2288d6a32d64fdbcb349b659f4b4ac', 'message': "We no longer need rootwrap.

(Well, except for starting privsep daemons, oh and nova-net,
oh and of course os-brick wants to know what our root helper is
for some reason that is a bit beyond me.)

Yes that's right, we now live in the future and no longer need
the run_as_root infrastructure in nova.utils. I'm sure this breaks
some out of tree drivers, but they've had an entire release to
notice that we're moving in this direction and its pretty easy
for them to fix themselves these days.

Do not merge this patch until we've gotten brave and deleted
nova-net once and for all. You have been warned.

Change-Id: I99c66558938db9beb0bda33d27a8e36b26b8fcac
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

commit_message:
We no longer need rootwrap.

(Well, except for starting privsep daemons, oh and of course
os-brick wants to know what our root helper is for some reason
that is a bit beyond me.)

Yes that's right, we now live in the future and no longer need
the run_as_root infrastructure in nova.utils. I'm sure this breaks
some out of tree drivers, but they've had several releases to
notice that we're moving in this direction and its pretty easy
for them to fix themselves these days.

Change-Id: I99c66558938db9beb0bda33d27a8e36b26b8fcac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/554438/44 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.i18n import _, _LE, _LW# NOTE(mikal): this seems to have to stay for now to handle os-brick # requirements. This makes me a sad panda.
deleted_lines:
import timefrom nova.i18n import _, _LE, _LI, _LWclass RootwrapProcessHelper(object): def trycmd(self, *cmd, **kwargs): kwargs['root_helper'] = get_root_helper() return processutils.trycmd(*cmd, **kwargs) def execute(self, *cmd, **kwargs): kwargs['root_helper'] = get_root_helper() return processutils.execute(*cmd, **kwargs) class RootwrapDaemonHelper(RootwrapProcessHelper): _clients = {} @synchronized('daemon-client-lock') def _get_client(cls, rootwrap_config): try: return cls._clients[rootwrap_config] except KeyError: from oslo_rootwrap import client new_client = client.Client([ "sudo", "nova-rootwrap-daemon", rootwrap_config]) cls._clients[rootwrap_config] = new_client return new_client def __init__(self, rootwrap_config): self.client = self._get_client(rootwrap_config) def trycmd(self, *args, **kwargs): discard_warnings = kwargs.pop('discard_warnings', False) try: out, err = self.execute(*args, **kwargs) failed = False except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exn: out, err = '', six.text_type(exn) failed = True if not failed and discard_warnings and err: # Handle commands that output to stderr but otherwise succeed err = '' return out, err def execute(self, *cmd, **kwargs): # NOTE(dims): This method is to provide compatibility with the # processutils.execute interface. So that calling daemon or direct # rootwrap to honor the same set of flags in kwargs and to ensure # that we don't regress any current behavior. cmd = [str(c) for c in cmd] loglevel = kwargs.pop('loglevel', logging.DEBUG) log_errors = kwargs.pop('log_errors', None) process_input = kwargs.pop('process_input', None) delay_on_retry = kwargs.pop('delay_on_retry', True) attempts = kwargs.pop('attempts', 1) check_exit_code = kwargs.pop('check_exit_code', [0]) ignore_exit_code = False if isinstance(check_exit_code, bool): ignore_exit_code = not check_exit_code check_exit_code = [0] elif isinstance(check_exit_code, int): check_exit_code = [check_exit_code] sanitized_cmd = strutils.mask_password(' '.join(cmd)) LOG.info(_LI('Executing RootwrapDaemonHelper.execute ' 'cmd=[%(cmd)r] kwargs=[%(kwargs)r]'), {'cmd': sanitized_cmd, 'kwargs': kwargs}) while attempts > 0: attempts -= 1 try: start_time = time.time() LOG.log(loglevel, _('Running cmd (subprocess): %s'), sanitized_cmd) (returncode, out, err) = self.client.execute( cmd, process_input) end_time = time.time() - start_time LOG.log(loglevel, 'CMD "%(sanitized_cmd)s" returned: %(return_code)s ' 'in %(end_time)0.3fs', {'sanitized_cmd': sanitized_cmd, 'return_code': returncode, 'end_time': end_time}) if not ignore_exit_code and returncode not in check_exit_code: out = strutils.mask_password(out) err = strutils.mask_password(err) raise processutils.ProcessExecutionError( exit_code=returncode, stdout=out, stderr=err, cmd=sanitized_cmd) return (out, err) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as err: # if we want to always log the errors or if this is # the final attempt that failed and we want to log that. if log_errors == processutils.LOG_ALL_ERRORS or ( log_errors == processutils.LOG_FINAL_ERROR and not attempts): format = _('%(desc)r
command: %(cmd)r
' 'exit code: %(code)r
stdout: %(stdout)r
' 'stderr: %(stderr)r') LOG.log(loglevel, format, {"desc": err.description, "cmd": err.cmd, "code": err.exit_code, "stdout": err.stdout, "stderr": err.stderr}) if not attempts: LOG.log(loglevel, _('%r failed. Not Retrying.'), sanitized_cmd) raise else: LOG.log(loglevel, _('%r failed. Retrying.'), sanitized_cmd) if delay_on_retry: time.sleep(random.randint(20, 200) / 100.0) if 'run_as_root' in kwargs and kwargs.get('run_as_root'): if CONF.use_rootwrap_daemon: return RootwrapDaemonHelper(CONF.rootwrap_config).execute( *cmd, **kwargs) else: return RootwrapProcessHelper().execute(*cmd, **kwargs) if kwargs.get('run_as_root', False): if CONF.use_rootwrap_daemon: return RootwrapDaemonHelper(CONF.rootwrap_config).trycmd( *args, **kwargs) else: return RootwrapProcessHelper().trycmd(*args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Cleanup the _execute shim in nova/network.

Originally for testing, it has been progressively replaced by more
specific mocking and can now be removed.

Change-Id: I11bf62d5ef3041541459d138bedb50aaeb702ae2

commit_message:
Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE is upstream EOL, let's remove the experimental job completely
so that we can remove 42.3 from CI.

Note that master uses a newer openSUSE 15 job but I don't want to add
support for new OS in a stable branch.

Change-Id: Ifc6b07eaff4922976e18393b9e7557193f461185

commit_message:
replace disable/enable_service with update_service

The Nova version Watcher neede is at least 2.56
Starting with microversion 2.53 disable/enable API
is superseded by PUT /os-services/{service_id}[1]

Depends-on: If21b0df50e2f2cc2884f531cb40084e95a688026
[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=update-compute-service-detail,disable-scheduling-for-a-compute-service-detail#update-compute-service

Change-Id: If3366db5cc49ced522e30f75e7f85b8671b947bd

added_lines: svr_id = cn_setup.get('id') status = initial_cn_setup.get('status') # The Nova version Watcher neede is at least 2.56 # Starting with microversion 2.53 disable/enable API # is superseded by PUT /os-services/{service_id} rollback_func = cls.mgr.services_client.update_service rollback_func(svr_id, status=status)
deleted_lines: if initial_cn_setup.get('status') == 'enabled': rollback_func = cls.mgr.services_client.enable_service else: rollback_func = cls.mgr.services_client.disable_service rollback_func(binary='nova-compute', host=cn_hostname)

subject: Change tricircle release model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-08 22:18:28.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/train/tricircle.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/6efa9b911d19a01c727c8e45778f12461a13dde9', 'message': 'Change tricircle release model

Since tricircle was only released once last cycle (and the cycle
before) AND it has not yet been released this cycle yet either,
we propose to change it to the cycle-with-rc model which is better
for deliverables that do a single release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: I8b822f2b9c173fd72bc6015f69a3703a963f1c4c
'}]
commit_message:
Change tricircle release model

Since tricircle was only released once last cycle (and the cycle
before) AND it has not yet been released this cycle yet either,
we propose to change it to the cycle-with-rc model which is better
for deliverables that do a single release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: I8b822f2b9c173fd72bc6015f69a3703a963f1c4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/90/675490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: release-model: cycle-with-rc

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError bug when creating nested stacks

Makes envfiles an empty dict instead of None. Also added a test that
reproduces the issue without the fix.

Task: 36321
Story: 2006424

Change-Id: Ia793195daad8b8a9c01f12de4df4d6f01033ad2b
Signed-off-by: Ghislain Bourgeois <ghislain.bourgeois@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/18/677718/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envfiles = dict()

commit_message:
Use promote job for infra

For using the promote jobs for publishing docs, change the docs job to
opendev-tox-docs so that the tarball gets generated that is needed for
publishing.

Update  publish-tox-docs-infra to use the promote job, update
release-tox-docs-infra to have the same jobs but no change of publish
job (promote job does not work for release pipeline).

Change-Id: Idc5e94a581359bcfd3a570e085aa13999c26eb86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/57/677657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - opendev-tox-docs - opendev-tox-docs promote: jobs: - promote-tox-docs-infra - opendev-tox-docs - opendev-tox-docs
deleted_lines: - tox-docs - tox-docs post: jobs: - publish-tox-docs-infra - tox-docs - tox-docs

commit_message:
Unify services list between rdo and suse

There is really no sense in keeping this list twice, it
will only run out of sync. the list of services is the
same no matter which flavor of OS we render for.

Change-Id: Ibb628b4d0f70e0ecc42b4921f14214ece1db9f17

commit_message:
REmove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE is upstream EOL, let's remove the experimental job completely
so that we can remove 42.3 from CI.

Note that master uses a newer openSUSE 15 job but I don't want to add
support for new OS in a stable branch.

Change-Id: I414ed303092168bc29400622f0738e17c4ed1b66

commit_message:
Add a hacking rule for non-existent assertions

Add a hacking rule for non-existent mock assertion methods and
attributes.

[N364] Non existent mock assertion method or attribute (<name>) is used.
       Check a typo or whether the assertion method should begin with
       'assert_'.

Change-Id: Ic6860e373120086a1a2ae9953f09a7bbaa032a7b

commit_message:
Fix RedHat entry in apache_config_path

With CentOS 7, ansible is expecting to have RedHat as an attribute for
the dict so Discover configurations task fails with an undefined
variable error.

Closes-Bug: #1750573
Change-Id: I5bf9c4057ca9f75d730add9e429d0ef050c6d900

commit_message:
Introduce the new rabbit_heartbeat_in_pthread option

oslo.messaging RabbitMQ driver have now a new option that allow user to
run the RabbitMQ heartbeat over a native python thread.

These change allow user to use this new option.

Change-Id: I0e3503342fcf7e211cf80e4af3ba75ac8cc917d4
Closes-Bug: #1840868
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/43/677643/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Allow users to run the RabbitMQ heartbeat over a native python thread in the oslo.messaging RabbitMQ driver, by using the `rabbit_heartbeat_in_pthread` option in configuration.

commit_message:
Add SQLAlchemy-collectd support

The SQLAlchemy-collectd plugin is now shipped in podman
containers under Kolla, this allows heat templates
to pull the plugin into the collectd configuration when
the collectd templates are being used.

A corresponding set of template changes in tripleo-heat-templates
will enable this plugin.

Change-Id: If598da717653a383a2d3b3373c56517f8bca832f

The nova [neutron]/url config option was deprecated in Queens [1]
and is being removed in Train [2]. The neutron install guide
sections about configuring compute to work with neutron were still
using the url option so this change removes them. There are a few
things to note here:

1. The url option functionality is replaced with the endpoint_override
   option from keystoneauth1 but we don't really want users using that
   unless there is a real need. One of the main reasons for moving the
   nova configuration to use keystoneauth1 was so that the network
   service endpoint can be looked up via KSA dynamically based on the
   configurable interfaces (public, internal, private) and service types

   config which makes deployment and config management simpler. As such,
   the url option removed in the install guide here is not replaced with
   the endpoint_override option.

2. Following on #1, the install guide portion about the nova/neutron config
   is updated with a link back to the nova config guide for the full set
   of options in case an operator needs to tweak the config, e.g. to set

   for their deployment.

3. With the old url option, if region_name was not specified, nova would
   default to 'RegionOne'. That is not the case if not using the url option
   so we leave the region_one config in the install guide example, otherwise
   region_name would default to None.

commit_message:
doc: remove deprecated [neutron]/url from compute install guide

The nova [neutron]/url config option was deprecated in Queens [1]
and is being removed in Train [2]. The neutron install guide
sections about configuring compute to work with neutron were still
using the url option so this change removes them. There are a few
things to note here:

1. The url option functionality is replaced with the endpoint_override
   option from keystoneauth1 but we don't really want users using that
   unless there is a real need. One of the main reasons for moving the
   nova configuration to use keystoneauth1 was so that the network
   service endpoint can be looked up via KSA dynamically based on the
   configurable interfaces (public, internal, private) and service types
   authority so the endpoint URL will just be pulled from the service
   catalog. That means not having to hard-code the endpoint URL in nova
   config which makes deployment and config management simpler. As such,
   the url option removed in the install guide here is not replaced with
   the endpoint_override option.

2. Following on #1, the install guide portion about the nova/neutron config
   is updated with a link back to the nova config guide for the full set
   of options in case an operator needs to tweak the config, e.g. to set
   valid_interfaces or endpoint_override because the KSA defaults don't work
   for their deployment.

3. With the old url option, if region_name was not specified, nova would
   default to 'RegionOne'. That is not the case if not using the url option
   so we leave the region_one config in the install guide example, otherwise
   region_name would default to None.

[1] I41724a612a5f3eabd504f3eaa9d2f9d141ca3f69
[2] I6c068a84c4c0bd88f088f9328d7897bfc1f843f1

Change-Id: I30445edeb8509330571db28c7d61dd63886e9e61
Closes-Bug: #1840930
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/10/677810/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: See the :nova-doc:`compute service configuration guide <configuration/config.html#neutron>` for the full set of options including overriding the service catalog endpoint URL if necessary.

subject: Disable cephfs provisioner in multinode jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-14 15:14:30.000000000', 'files': ['tools/deployment/armada/manifests/armada-osh.yaml', 'tools/deployment/multinode/040-ceph-ns-activate.sh', 'tools/deployment/multinode/030-ceph.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/955edfdb28393712f7d80f1f7702150a4b800e30', 'message': 'Disable cephfs provisioner in multinode jobs

This disables the cephfs provisioner in the multinode
periodic jobs. It seems the helm tests for the ceph
provisioner chart that test cephfs fail more often than
not in the multinode jobs while passing reliably in the
single node check and gate jobs. As cephfs is still
gated, disabling the cephfs provisioner in the periodic
jobs allows for further investigation into this issue
without causing potential regressions

Change-Id: Id4cf7d6571855413be4b67a440423445af3270e3
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Disable cephfs provisioner in multinode jobs

This disables the cephfs provisioner in the multinode
periodic jobs. It seems the helm tests for the ceph
provisioner chart that test cephfs fail more often than
not in the multinode jobs while passing reliably in the
single node check and gate jobs. As cephfs is still
gated, disabling the cephfs provisioner in the periodic
jobs allows for further investigation into this issue
without causing potential regressions

Change-Id: Id4cf7d6571855413be4b67a440423445af3270e3
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/40/676440/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cephfs_provisioner: falsestorageclass: cephfs: provision_storage_class: false manifests: deployment_cephfs_provisioner: false job_cephfs_client_key: false

commit_message:
Update NexentaStor5 driver

- Disable SmartCompression feature for NFS backend. Thick provisioned
  volumes created as files containing zeros are not being compressed
  with standard compression if SmartCompression feature is enabled.
  This functionality will be fixed in a later release.
- Update driver features.
- Update default REST API port.
- Update recommended NFS options.

Change-Id: Icc509ce074d17ee073c58c43d98215fef5ad55c3

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-watcher refs/changes/28/677628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*rabbit_heartbeat_in_pthread*] # (Optional) EXPERIMENTAL: Run the health check heartbeat thread # through a native python thread. By default if this # option isn't provided the health check heartbeat will # inherit the execution model from the parent process. By # example if the parent process have monkey patched the # stdlib by using eventlet/greenlet then the heartbeat # will be run through a green thread. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $rabbit_heartbeat_in_pthread = $::os_service_default, heartbeat_in_pthread => $rabbit_heartbeat_in_pthread,

commit_message:
Multi-Interface for C-VNF User Guide

This is user guide for Multi interface of Containerized VNF.

Change-Id: I5e74c8eeed8c747c267bde0c1914aae26dd4ea6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/63/677863/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2018 NTT DATA Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. ========================= Multi-Interface for C-VNF ========================= This document describes the way to use multi-interface. At first, Tacker should install with Kubernetes VIM feature. 1. Edit local.conf file by adding the following content .. code-block:: console # Enable kuryr-kubernetes, docker, octavia KUBERNETES_VIM=True enable_plugin kuryr-kubernetes https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes master enable_plugin octavia https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia master enable_plugin devstack-plugin-container https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-container master KURYR_K8S_CLUSTER_IP_RANGE="10.0.0.0/24" 2. Checking kuryr.conf After installation, user should check kuryr.conf configuration. .. code-block:: console $ sudo cat /etc/kuryr/kuryr.conf | grep multi_vif_drivers $ multi_vif_drivers = npwg_multiple_interfaces 3. Adding K8s CustomResourceDefinition To use CustomResourceDefinition, user add CRD. Create crdnetwork.yaml like below and register it. .. code-block:: console $ sudo cat ~/crdnetwork.yaml .. code-block:: yaml apiVersion: apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1 kind: CustomResourceDefinition metadata: name: network-attachment-definitions.k8s.cni.cncf.io spec: group: k8s.cni.cncf.io version: v1 scope: Namespaced names: plural: network-attachment-definitions singular: network-attachment-definition kind: NetworkAttachmentDefinition shortNames: - net-attach-def validation: openAPIV3Schema: properties: spec: properties: config: type: string Registrate crdnetwork.yaml .. code-block:: console $ sudo kubectl create -f ~/crdnetwork.yaml Get crd list .. code-block:: console $ sudo cat ~/kubectl get crd NAME CREATED AT kuryrnetpolicies.openstack.org 2019-07-31T02:23:54Z kuryrnets.openstack.org 2019-07-31T02:23:54Z network-attachment-definitions.k8s.cni.cncf.io 2019-07-31T02:23:55Z 4. Adding neutron subnet id information to k8s CRD To use neutron subnet in kubernetes, user should register neutron subnet to CRD At first, user should create subnet.yaml file. .. code-block:: console $ sudo cat ~/kuryr-subnetname1.yaml apiVersion: "k8s.cni.cncf.io/v1" kind: NetworkAttachmentDefinition metadata: name: subnetname1 annotations: openstack.org/kuryr-config: '{"subnetId": "$subnet_id"}' After make a yaml file, user should create subnet with yaml file. .. code-block:: console $ sudo kubectl create -f ~/kuryr-subnetname1.yaml After created, user can check subnet info like below. .. code-block:: console $ sudo kubectl get net-attach-def NAME AGE k8s-multi-10 7d k8s-multi-11 7d

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35942

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I3ad4084a6e3298625cbe9267bc84a092f9217c8f

commit_message:
Adds functional test for creating the instance with vgpus

Ensure the vgpus being claimed/unclaimed correctly when boot
and destory the instance.

Change-Id: I6e8e58ee252128abf7f40f02ff357cfa80e197af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/98/671398/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.virt.libvirt import device as libvirt_device # NOTE(alex_xu): But we still want to test DeviceManager can # re-initialize correctly. So reset the DeviceManager. old_driver._device_manager = libvirt_device.DeviceManager( old_driver)

subject: Using the claim/unclaim_for_instance for mdevs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-17 09:27:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4dfa2e6b1bd54891bdfd6dd828f84f05dfd23ee9', 'message': "[WIP] Using the claim/unclaim_for_instance for mdevs

Implement the mediated device claim/unclaim in the DeviceManager.
The claim and unclaim are based on the usage tracking in memory.

The claim logic is similar to original LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs
method. It will try to allocate the mdev from the existing and not
assigned mdevs. If there isn't enough existing mdevs, it will check
with libvirt whether it can create more mdevs. If it can, then creates
new mdev and adds the new mdev into the DeviceManager.

When there isn't enough mdevs for the request, raises
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable`. If the request is asking
mulitple mdevs, any one of mdev can't be claimed, all mdevs's claim
should be rollback.

The DeviceManager is initialized in the LibvirtDriver.init_host
after recreate assgined mdevs. Since the populatation of existing
mdevs in DeviceManager depends on that. When initialze the
DeviceManager the mininum version of mdev support being checked,
otherwise passing `False to `support_mdev` param to skip the
populatoin of existing mdevs in DeviceManager.

Using the `DeviceManager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance` to get
the assigned mdevs when spawn the instance. So the
`LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs` method is useless now.

Related-Bug: #1836204
Change-Id: I3b9f695e1f596553dbc972d74e8d6d32ea44e47d
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-07-18 03:23:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/43c7cd102d25e76015a98085fcccf0fe287585a1', 'message': "[WIP] Using the claim/unclaim_for_instance for mdevs

The claim logic is similar to original LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs
method. It will try to allocate the mdev from the existing and not
assigned mdevs. If there isn't enough existing mdevs, it will check
with libvirt whether it can create more mdevs. If it can, then creates
new mdev and adds the new mdev into the DeviceManager.

When there isn't enough mdevs for the request, raises
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable`. If the request is asking
mulitple mdevs, any one of mdev can't be claimed, all mdevs's claim
should be rollback.

The DeviceManager is initialized in the LibvirtDriver.init_host
after recreate assgined mdevs. Since the populatation of existing
mdevs in DeviceManager depends on that. When initialze the
DeviceManager the mininum version of mdev support being checked,
otherwise passing `False to `support_mdev` param to skip the
populatoin of existing mdevs in DeviceManager.

Using the `DeviceManager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance` to get
the assigned mdevs when spawn the instance. So the
`LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs` method is useless now.

Related-Bug: #1836204
Change-Id: I3b9f695e1f596553dbc972d74e8d6d32ea44e47d

commit_message:
Using the claim/unclaim_for_instance for mdevs

Implement the mediated device claim/unclaim in the DeviceManager.
The claim and unclaim are based on the usage tracking in memory.

The claim logic is similar to original LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs
method. It will try to allocate the mdev from the existing and not
assigned mdevs. If there isn't enough existing mdevs, it will check
with libvirt whether it can create more mdevs. If it can, then creates
new mdev and adds the new mdev into the DeviceManager.

When there isn't enough mdevs for the request, raises
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable`. If the request is asking
mulitple mdevs, any one of mdev can't be claimed, all mdevs's claim
should be rollback.

The DeviceManager is initialized in the LibvirtDriver.init_host
after recreate assgined mdevs. Since the populatation of existing
mdevs in DeviceManager depends on that. When initialze the
DeviceManager the mininum version of mdev support being checked,
otherwise passing `False to `support_mdev` param to skip the
populatoin of existing mdevs in DeviceManager.

Using the `DeviceManager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance` to get
the assigned mdevs when spawn the instance. So the
`LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs` method is useless now.

Related-Bug: #1836204
Change-Id: I3b9f695e1f596553dbc972d74e8d6d32ea44e47d

commit_message:
Populates the existing mediated devices in the libvirt device manager

Adds DeviceManager to the libvirt virt driver, avoid to spread the device
usage tracking code all over the libvirt virt driver.

Implement the population of exising mediated device when initializing
the DeviceManager. The `supports_mdev` parameter is used for libvirt
virt driver to check whether the running version of libvirt supports
mediated devices.

The `_populate_existing_mdevs` will get the all mediated devices based
on the type `CONF.device.enabled_vgpu_types` from libvirt. It also
populates all the guest to get the assigned mediated devices and
update the usage in the DeviceManager.

Related-Bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Ie0aa9cb08c7d5aa7c5a47dbbbfedfc02d8e0be18

commit_message:
Add DeviceManager to the libvirt virt driver

The DeviceManager avoids to spread the device usage tracking code all
over the libvirt virt driver.

The patch only add the basic interface for the DeviceManager. And
instantiate a DeviceManager object in the libvirt virt driver.

Change-Id: If41122581a1659e15a082862e489cb2a5cb68e45

commit_message:
Calling the virt driver's claim/unclaim_for_instance in resource tracker

The `claim_for_instance` is called inside `ResourceTracker.instance_claim`,
`ResourceTracker.rebuild_claim`, and `ResourceTracker.resize_claim`. It is
also called when unshelve the offload instance which isn't covered by
the ResourceTracker.

The unclaim_for_instance is called inside
`ResourceTracking.abort_instance_claim` to ensure rollback the claim when
the action failure. It is also called when terminate the instance
and shelve offload the instance.

Related-Bug: 1836204
Change-Id: I44bf6845b1b901eb300a33d15c8bb7b438092836

commit_message:
Moves the allocation retrieving early

Moves the allocation retrieving early, it will be used for claiming the
physical resources for `VirtDriver.claim_for_instance`, which is called
by the `ResourceTracker.instance_claim` method

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: I02904df438db4debc318632406aa5267d31895bc

subject: Add the virt driver interface for claim and unclaim the devices
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-15 08:23:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a1c63deb695a4ef668ca2dcc7e9717537a520a9d', 'message': 'Add the virt driver interface for managing the devices

The `claim/unclaim_for_instance` interface added to the virt driver. The
instance object and placement allocation records as the parameters. The
virt driver should base on the placement allocation records to allocate the
corresponding devices. And using the instance object to reference the consumer.

The `claim_for_instance` will return the a list of assigned devices which are
`Device` object. The different type of device should be a subclass of Deivce
object. Each virt driver also can create subclass for each type device if
specific data needed.

The `DeviceManager` is an interface for tracking all the devices for the virt
driver. Each virt driver will create a subclass of DeviceManager to implement
the tracking.

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Icce24b887127dce1b626f2758234a0db0e4c1be9

should be invoked.

commit_message:
Add the virt driver interface for claim and unclaim the devices

There are two reasons to add an resource claim and unclaim interfaces for
the virt driver.

* The placement only know about how many resource available on the node. But
  have no idea on which specific resource should be allocated to the instance.
* The different virt driver has different way to manage the resources. And not
  all of resources supported by all the virt driver. The virt driver should
  implement it own way to track the resource usage.

The 'claim_for_instance' and 'unclaim_for_instance' are added to the virt
driver. The (instance_uuid, flavor_id) are a tuple to reference the consumer.
The allocation records are used for virt driver to parse the request.

Due to support the resize action on the same host, the original claimed
resource and target claimed resource are on the same host and in the memory.
There need a way to distinguish the claim. That is why need flavor_id
as part of identify of the consumer.

When spawn the instance on the node, the `claim_for_instance` should be
invoked. If the virt driver can't get enough resource, the
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable` should be raised.

When destory and any error raised when spawn the instanc, the
`unclaim_for_instance` should be invoked.

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Icce24b887127dce1b626f2758234a0db0e4c1be9

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. class Device(object): """The interface for managing the device""" def __init__(self): self.instance_uuid = None def assign(self, instance_uuid): """Assign the device to the instance :param instance_uuid: The UUID of instance. """ self.instance_uuid = instance_uuid def unassign(self): """Unassign the device""" self.instance_uuid = None def is_assigned(self): """Check the device is assigned or not""" return bool(self.instance_uuid) def migrate_data(self, remote_addr, dest_device): """Migrate the data of device to a remote device :param remote_addr: The remote address of the data migrating to. :param dest_device: The Device object for the remote device. """ pass def purge(self): """ Purge the data on the device""" pass class DeviceManager(object): """The interface for virt driver to track the devices""" def claim_for_instance(self, instance, allocations): """Claim all the requested device for instance :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object. :param allocations: The placement allocation records. """ pass def unclaim_for_instance(self, instance): """Unclaim all the devices for the instance :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object. """ pass def migrate_data(self, instance, remote_addr): """Migrate the data of devices for the instance to the remote :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object. :param remote_addr: The remote address of the data migrating to. """ pass def purge(self, instance): """Purge the data for the devices of instance :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object """ pass def get_assigned_devices(self, instance): """Get the assigned devices for an instance :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object. :return: A list of nova.virt.device.Device objects. """ pass

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/24/675024/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: After resize VM, the data of source virtual persistent memory devices won't be copied to the target virtual persistent memory devices. There also no limit on add/remove virtual persistent memory devices for the VM by resize. .. note:: For same host resize, nova only create one domain in the libvirt. If the nova-compute down before confirming the resize, the old flavor's assignment of virtual persistent memory devices will be lost. For this case, the resize can't be reverted. The end-user will get an error when revert the resize and nova-compute can't found the virtual persistent memory assignment for the old flavor. For safety, a cleanup will be executed on all free virtual persistent memory devices when any uncomfirmed resize found... note:: In the target host, the libvirt will cleanup the live migration target domain if the nova-compute down. The nova-compute can't popluate the assignment of target virtual persistent memory when restart. For safety, a cleanup will be executed for all the non-assigned virtual persistent memory when any incompelete migration found. Since the libvirt provides the persistent of instance info. The `nova-compute` always can populate the existing assignment of virtual PMEMs to the instance from the libvirt. There needn't data model for Nova DB to persistent the assignment of virtual PMEMs.
deleted_lines: Adding new virtual persistent memory devices to an instance is allowed. As for a concrete virtual persistent memory device, changing its backing namespace's resource class is not allowed. This is because it is not always possible to compare the sizes of two namespaces in different resource classes (e.g. CUSTOM_PMEM_NAMESPACE_128G and CUSTOM_PMEM_NAMESPACE_MEDIUM). By default the content of the original virtual persistent memory is copied to the new virtual persistent memory (if there is). This could be time consuming, so a flavor extra spec is introduced as a flag:: hw:allow_pmem_copy=true|false (default false) If either the source or target has this flag set to ``true``, the data in virtual persistent memory is copied. If both the source and target have this flag set to ``false``, the data in virtual persistent memory is not copied. This (not copying data) is useful in scenarios such as virtual persistent memory is used as cache. For a graceful shutdown (which resize does), the data in the cache is flushed, so no need to copy the data. Nova compute libvirt driver uses daxio_ utility to read out the data from the source persistent memory namespace and write in to the target persistent memory namespace. If the source and target persistent memory namespaces are not on the same host, ssh tunnel is used to channel the data transfer. This ssh tunnel uses the same ssh key as of moving VM disks during resize. The copying via network won't work in case of cross-cell resize since there is no direct connectivity between the source and target host.A new VirtualPMEM object is introduced to track the virtual PMEM information of an instance, it stands for a virtual persistent memory device backed by a physical persistent memory namespace: .. code-block:: python class VirtualPMEM(base.NovaObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = "1.0" fields = { 'rc_name': fields.StringField(), 'ns_name': fields.StringField(nullable=True), } In addition a VirtualPMEMList object is introduced to represent a list of VirtualPMEM objects: .. code-block:: python class VirtualPMEMList(base.NovaObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = "1.0" fields = { 'vpmems': fields.ListOfObjectsField('VirtualPMEM'), } A 'vpmems' deferred-load column is added to class InstanceExtra, which stores a serialized VirtualPMEMList object for a given instance: .. code-block:: python class InstanceExtra(BASE, NovaBase, models.SoftDeleteMixin): ... migration_context = orm.deferred(Column(Text)) keypairs = orm.deferred(Column(Text)) trusted_certs = orm.deferred(Column(Text)) vpmems = orm.deferred(Column(Text)) instance = orm.relationship(Instance, ... Two new fields are introduced to MigrationContext to hold the old and new virtual persistent memory devices during migration: .. code-block:: python class MigrationContext(base.NovaPersistentObject, base.NovaObject): ... fields = { 'old_pci_requests': fields.ObjectField('InstancePCIRequests', nullable=True), 'new_vpmems': fields.ObjectField('VirtualPMEMList', nullable=True), 'old_vpmems': fields.ObjectField('VirtualPMEMList', nullable=True), }

commit_message:
Move enable_nova after enable_ironic

The ironic environment also deploys an ironic configured nova-compute,
however this should not be deployed if enable_nova=false.

This change moves enable_nova after enable_ironic so that nova-compute
is not deployed when enable_nova=false.

Change-Id: Icbc549fac9d83caffb282632e442736cac17ad1e
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Add generate_connector_list

This patch adds a new tool that generates a list of connectors
that exist in os-brick.

Change-Id: I59c4f9360f13ec3913b9e2b0a9e81d1d517911b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/67/643667/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
#! /usr/bin/env python # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Generate list of os-brick connectors""" import argparse import inspect import json import operator import os from pydoc import locate import textwrap from os_brick.initiator import connector parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(prog="generate_connector_list") parser.add_argument("--format", default='str', choices=['str', 'dict'], help="Output format type") # Keep backwards compatibilty with the gate-docs test # The tests pass ['docs'] on the cmdln, but it's never been used. parser.add_argument("output_list", default=None, nargs='?') def _ensure_loaded(connector_list): """Loads everything in a given path. This will make sure all classes have been loaded and therefore all decorators have registered class. :param start_path: The starting path to load. """ classes = [] for conn in connector_list: try: conn_class = locate(conn) classes.append(conn_class) except Exception: pass return classes def get_connectors(): """Get a list of all connectors.""" classes = _ensure_loaded(connector.connector_list) return [DriverInfo(x) for x in classes] class DriverInfo(object): """Information about Connector implementations.""" def __init__(self, cls): self.cls = cls self.desc = cls.__doc__ self.class_name = cls.__name__ self.class_fqn = '{}.{}'.format(inspect.getmodule(cls).__name__, self.class_name) self.platform = getattr(cls, 'platform', None) self.os_type = getattr(cls, 'os_type', None) def __str__(self): return self.class_name def __repr__(self): return self.class_fqn def __hash__(self): return hash(self.class_fqn) class Output(object): def __init__(self, base_dir, output_list): # At this point we don't care what was passed in, just a trigger # to write this out to the doc tree for now self.connector_file = None if output_list: self.connector_file = open( '%s/doc/source/connectors.rst' % base_dir, 'w+') self.connector_file.write('===================
') self.connector_file.write('Available Connectors
') self.connector_file.write('===================

') def __enter__(self): return self def __exit__(self, type, value, traceback): if self.connector_file: self.connector_file.close() def write(self, text): if self.connector_file: self.connector_file.write('%s
' % text) else: print(text) def format_description(desc, output): desc = desc or '<None>' lines = desc.rstrip('
').split('
') output.write('* Description: %s' % lines[0]) output.write('') output.write(textwrap.dedent('
'.join(lines[1:]))) def format_options(connector_options, output): if connector_options and len(connector_options) > 0: output.write('* Driver Configuration Options:') output.write('') output.write('.. list-table:: **Driver configuration options**') output.write(' :header-rows: 1') output.write(' :widths: 14 30') output.write('') output.write(' * - Name = Default Value') output.write(' - (Type) Description') sorted_options = sorted(connector_options, key=operator.attrgetter('name')) for opt in sorted_options: output.write(' * - %s = %s' % (opt.name, opt.default)) output.write(' - (%s) %s' % (opt.type, opt.help)) output.write('') def print_connectors(connectors, config_name, output, section_char='-'): for conn in sorted(connectors, key=lambda x: x.class_name): conn_name = conn.class_name output.write(conn_name) output.write(section_char * len(conn_name)) if conn.platform: output.write('* Platform: %s' % conn.platform) if conn.os_type: output.write('* OS Type: %s' % conn.os_type) output.write('* %s=%s' % (config_name, conn.class_fqn)) format_description(conn.desc, output) output.write('') output.write('') def output_str(cinder_root, args): with Output(cinder_root, args.output_list) as output: output.write('Connectors') output.write('==============') connectors = get_connectors() print_connectors(connectors, 'connector', output, '~') def collect_connector_info(connector): """Build the dictionary that describes this connector.""" info = {'name': connector.class_name, 'fqn': connector.class_fqn, 'description': connector.desc, 'platform': connector.platform, 'os_type': connector.os_type, } return info def output_dict(): """Output the results as a JSON dict.""" connector_list = [] connectors = get_connectors() for conn in connectors: connector_list.append(collect_connector_info(conn)) print(json.dumps(connector_list)) def main(): tools_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)) brick_root = os.path.dirname(tools_dir) cur_dir = os.getcwd() os.chdir(brick_root) args = parser.parse_args() try: if args.format == 'str': output_str(brick_root, args) elif args.format == 'dict': output_dict() finally: os.chdir(cur_dir) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35930

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia7da63537eb90750e7b9a2c453e82d248b91037f

commit_message:
Remove OpenShift containers

See I6a73f7f22dda69bef324ffdaecdcd6be693c1257 for the whole context
but we are removing OpenShift from TripleO.

Note: the scripts/tripleo-deploy-openshift script hasn't been removed
yet because we need to update the packaging first in
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/21749 but first it requires the unit
tests to be removed.

Change-Id: Ia64ceb1f05d96d2358509392bb3cbc3b9cb61030

subject: Make the rabbitmq-ready exec more stringent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-20 06:52:53.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/pacemaker/rabbitmq_bundle.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/cb5102003b811d1835b8f03eb2b83f612094a788', 'message': 'Make the rabbitmq-ready exec more stringent

Currently we use the following command to determine if rabbit is
up and running *and* ready to service requests:
rabbitmqctl eval "rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered()." | grep -q true

Now we have occasionally observed that rabbitmqctl policies commands
which are executed after said exec['rabbitmq-ready'] will fail.

One potential reason is that is_clustered() can return true *before*
the rabbit app is actually running. In fact we can see it does
return true even though the app is stopped:
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl stop_app
Stopping rabbit application on node rabbit@controller-1 ...
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered().'
true

Let's switch to a combination of commands that check for the cluster to
be up *and* the rabbitmq app to be running:
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl stop_app
Stopping rabbit application on node rabbit@controller-1 ...
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_nodes:is_running(node(), rabbit).'
false

Suggested-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1835615

Change-Id: I29f779145a39cd16374a91626f7fae1581a18224
'}]
commit_message:
Make the rabbitmq-ready exec more stringent

Currently we use the following command to determine if rabbit is
up and running *and* ready to service requests:
rabbitmqctl eval "rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered()." | grep -q true

Now we have occasionally observed that rabbitmqctl policies commands
which are executed after said exec['rabbitmq-ready'] will fail.

One potential reason is that is_clustered() can return true *before*
the rabbit app is actually running. In fact we can see it does
return true even though the app is stopped:
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl stop_app
Stopping rabbit application on node rabbit@controller-1 ...
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered().'
true

Let's switch to a combination of commands that check for the cluster to
be up *and* the rabbitmq app to be running:
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl stop_app
Stopping rabbit application on node rabbit@controller-1 ...
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_nodes:is_running(node(), rabbit).'
false

Suggested-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1835615

Change-Id: I29f779145a39cd16374a91626f7fae1581a18224
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/05/677405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $cmd1 = 'rabbitmqctl eval "rabbit_nodes:is_running(node(), rabbit)." | grep -q true' $cmd2 = 'rabbitmqctl eval "rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered()." | grep -q true' $check_command = "${cmd1} && ${cmd2}"

commit_message:
Bump minimum ksa (3.16.0) and sdk (0.34.0)

A number of different efforts are going to need to make use of
openstacksdk 0.34.0 and keystoneauth1 3.16.0, so rather than bump the
minimum in all of those, bump it in one place.

Also, this gives us the opportunity to independently validate some of
the fixes (particularly in logging) we were expecting to affect nova.

Change-Id: I87d1dcd299f6547d5f3c3d77e219bf71aba1cff2

commit_message:
Place fd type outside storlets metadata

Previously, we place fd type information in storlets metadata when
building FDMetadata. However, fd type infomation is used inside sbus,
and not used by storlets module directly.

This patch takes fd type out of storlets metadata, and place it
at the top level so that sbus uses only the first level keys, (type,
storlets and storage), which makes FDMetadata handling more simple.

Change-Id: Ice3e1c3b99a2549b378ee5e896e2fc4241a0169c

commit_message:
Use secure sha256 instead of sha1

Fix for bandit B303: Use of insecure MD2, MD4, MD5, or SHA1 hash function.

Change-Id: I00403d7bd3b40ae00420e6cddcf40f45488284a9

commit_message:
Add 'tag' support to compute with supported microversion

A 'tag' could be specified for the interface when the nova microversion
is 2.32-2.36 or >= 2.42.
Add support to the 'tag' use.

Change-Id: Ia9f95ef4ed285012e157d758dfbec69df4010350
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/06/675306/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'tag' in nic: if self.compute.default_microversion and \ (2.32 <= float(self.compute.default_microversion) <= 2.36 or float(self.compute.default_microversion) >= 2.42): net['tag'] = nic.pop('tag') else: raise exc.OpenStackCloudException( "The 'tag' attribute for the interface " "supported in microversion 2.32-2.36 or >= 2.42")

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

subject: zypper-minimal: Don't get confused by etc/resolv.conf symlink
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-21 17:57:33.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/zypper-minimal/root.d/08-zypper-chroot'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/6c23b97f4a2226e24976e7943d7be4f3a326ea98', 'message': "zypper-minimal: Don't get confused by etc/resolv.conf symlink

Newer openSUSE distributions install an absolute link to /run/netconfig
as /etc/resolv.conf in $TARGET_ROOT. as that points outside
TARGET_ROOT, we unintentionally wipe the system resolv.conf here
and break our ability to finish building the image.

Change-Id: I9d5aaa9fad2f81dcabfe19e2f1e6b6e50af597d7
"}]
commit_message:
zypper-minimal: Don't get confused by etc/resolv.conf symlink

Newer openSUSE distributions install an absolute link to /run/netconfig
as /etc/resolv.conf in $TARGET_ROOT. as that points outside
TARGET_ROOT, we unintentionally wipe the system resolv.conf here
and break our ability to finish building the image.

Change-Id: I9d5aaa9fad2f81dcabfe19e2f1e6b6e50af597d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/96/677796/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Remove the installed symlink, otherwise we wipe the resolv.conf # outside the target_root (as the link is not relative) # outside target_root test -L $TARGET_ROOT/etc/resolv.conf && sudo rm -f $TARGET_ROOT/etc/resolv.conf

commit_message:
MairaDB: Move all config to be values driven

This PS moves to drive all mariadb config via the values fed
to the chart.

Change-Id: I4ed3624737af4d5c90b1b5de451a0a0b75a5eda1
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. */}} [mysqld] # Charset character_set_server=utf8 collation_server=utf8_unicode_ci skip-character-set-client-handshake # Logging slow_query_log=off slow_query_log_file=/var/log/mysql/mariadb-slow.log log_warnings=2 # General logging has huge performance penalty therefore is disabled by default general_log=off general_log_file=/var/log/mysql/mariadb-error.log long_query_time=3 log_queries_not_using_indexes=on # Networking bind_address=0.0.0.0 port={{ tuple "oslo_db" "direct" "mysql" . | include "helm-toolkit.endpoints.endpoint_port_lookup" }} # When a client connects, the server will perform hostname resolution, # and when DNS is slow, establishing the connection will become slow as well. # It is therefore recommended to start the server with skip-name-resolve to # disable all DNS lookups. The only limitation is that the GRANT statements # must then use IP addresses only. skip_name_resolve # Tuning user=mysql max_allowed_packet=256M open_files_limit=10240 max_connections=8192 max-connect-errors=1000000 ## Generally, it is unwise to set the query cache to be larger than 64-128M ## as the costs associated with maintaining the cache outweigh the performance ## gains. ## The query cache is a well known bottleneck that can be seen even when ## concurrency is moderate. The best option is to disable it from day 1 ## by setting query_cache_size=0 (now the default on MySQL 5.6) ## and to use other ways to speed up read queries: good indexing, adding ## replicas to spread the read load or using an external cache. query_cache_size=0 query_cache_type=0 sync_binlog=0 thread_cache_size=16 table_open_cache=2048 table_definition_cache=1024 # # InnoDB # # The buffer pool is where data and indexes are cached: having it as large as possible # will ensure you use memory and not disks for most read operations. # Typical values are 50..75% of available RAM. # TODO(tomasz.paszkowski): This needs to by dynamic based on available RAM. innodb_buffer_pool_size=1024M innodb_doublewrite=0 innodb_file_format=Barracuda innodb_file_per_table=1 innodb_flush_method=O_DIRECT innodb_io_capacity=500 innodb_locks_unsafe_for_binlog=1 innodb_log_file_size=128M innodb_old_blocks_time=1000 innodb_read_io_threads=8 innodb_write_io_threads=8 # Clustering binlog_format=ROW default-storage-engine=InnoDB innodb_autoinc_lock_mode=2 innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit=2 wsrep_cluster_name={{ tuple "oslo_db" "direct" . | include "helm-toolkit.endpoints.hostname_namespaced_endpoint_lookup" | replace "." "_" }} wsrep_on=1 wsrep_provider=/usr/lib/galera/libgalera_smm.so wsrep_provider_options="evs.suspect_timeout=PT30S; gmcast.peer_timeout=PT15S; gmcast.listen_addr=tcp://0.0.0.0:{{ tuple "oslo_db" "direct" "wsrep" . | include "helm-toolkit.endpoints.endpoint_port_lookup" }}" wsrep_slave_threads=12 wsrep_sst_auth={{ .Values.endpoints.oslo_db.auth.sst.username }}:{{ .Values.endpoints.oslo_db.auth.sst.password }} wsrep_sst_method=mariabackup [mysqldump] max-allowed-packet=16M [client] default_character_set=utf8 protocol=tcp port={{ tuple "oslo_db" "direct" "mysql" . | include "helm-toolkit.endpoints.endpoint_port_lookup" }}

commit_message:
Re-use DB MetaData during archive_deleted_rows

This simply passes the database engine metadata
from archive_deleted_rows to _archive_deleted_rows_for_table
so the latter does not need to get the engine and create a
new MetaData object for each table processed.

Change-Id: If42acd953dc9bd09972e974f7bb04d5bab701a40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/18/675218/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _archive_deleted_rows_for_table(metadata, tablename, max_rows, before): conn = metadata.bind engine = get_engine(use_slave=True) meta = MetaData(engine) meta, tablename,
deleted_lines: def _archive_deleted_rows_for_table(tablename, max_rows, before): engine = get_engine() conn = engine.connect() metadata = MetaData() metadata.bind = engine meta = MetaData(get_engine(use_slave=True)) tablename,

commit_message:
Switch to promote docs job

We now use a promote job for publishing that avoids building again the
documents after merge. use this here as well.

We can only use the promote jobs when the job run in gate, so use the
same file conditions. To make those easier to sync, get rid of the
special tripleo job and use openstack-tox-docs directly.

For further details about promote jobs, see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Change-Id: I31fa0d59ce2715abe6c36ecfbca8f6a70aaa60e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/91/677791/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - openstack-tox-docs: &tripleo-docs files: - ^doc/.* - ^README.rst - openstack-tox-docs: *tripleo-docs promote: jobs: - promote-openstack-tox-docs: *tripleo-docs

commit_message:
Use python docstring.

Use the python docstring format for the documentation of the function.
Add the documentation for the parameter and raise error. Remove the
unless variable.

Change-Id: I83353eaa6f927b62b9840daeb2b8c0a1c836acfa

commit_message:
Add an undeploy_roles workflow

This expands a list of instances with provisioned==False, then
unprovisions those instances. It will be run as the last step of a
scale-down or overcloud delete.

Change-Id: I9e9f1327070476326597c42ed14280a2088544bf
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

added_lines: undeploy_roles: description: Undeploy provisioned=False instances in roles. input: - roles - plan: overcloud - timeout: 3600 - concurrency: 20 - queue_name: tripleo tags: - tripleo-common-managed tasks: expand_roles: action: tripleo.baremetal_deploy.expand_roles input: roles: <% $.roles %> stackname: <% $.plan %> provisioned: False publish: input_instances: <% task().result.instances %> publish-on-error: status: FAILED message: <% task().result %> on-success: undeploy_instances on-error: send_message undeploy_instances: workflow: tripleo.baremetal_deploy.v1.undeploy_instances input: instances: <% $.input_instances %> timeout: <% $.timeout %> queue_name: <% $.queue_name %> publish-on-error: status: FAILED message: <% task().result %> on-success: send_message on-error: send_message send_message: workflow: tripleo.messaging.v1.send input: queue_name: <% $.queue_name %> type: <% execution().name %> status: <% $.get('status', 'SUCCESS') %> message: <% $.get('message', '') %> execution: <% execution() %> payload: environment: <% $.get('environment', {}) %> instances: <% $.get('instances', {}) %>

commit_message:
keystone: drop duplicate -DFOREGROUND

No need to specify this as kolla adds this arg automatically
when using kolla_start.

Note that the commit this was cherry picked from does not apply
cleanly, as docker/services/keystone.yaml is used in Rocky and
earlier, while Stein and later use puppet/services/keystone.yaml.

Conflicts:
       puppet/services/keystone.yaml

Change-Id: Ib179e3bbc827cc438519b19e85bda4a9994376b9

commit_message:
Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so that
CI can remove the job completely.

On master this job has been converted to 15, let's not do this on the
branch.

subject: 3PAR: Add config for NSP single path attach
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-19 15:10:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/13fb9893093107ba16bb3757dd1458281066f247', 'message': '3PAR: Add config for NSP single path attach

This fix aims to resolve below mentioned bugs:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1812665
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1809249
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1734917

Given a system connected to HPE 3PAR via FC and multipath is disabled.
When user tries to create bootable volume, it fails intermittently
with following error:

    Fibre Channel volume device not found

This happens when a zone is created using second or later target nsp
from 3PAR backend. In this case, HPE 3PAR client code picks up first
target nsp to form initiator target map.

To avoid above mentioned failure, user can specify target nsp in 3PAR
backend section of cinder.conf as follows:

    hpe3par_target_nsp = <n:s:p>

This target information is read from cinder.conf and respective
wwn information is fetched. Later initiator target map is created
using wwn information and bootable volume is created successfully.

Change-Id: I2da5d4a0334f07967af5ff7aaa39a0ecc4b12204

commit_message:
3PAR: Add config for NSP single path attach

This fix aims to resolve below mentioned bugs:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1812665
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1809249
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1734917

Given a system connected to HPE 3PAR via FC and multipath is disabled.
When user tries to create bootable volume, it fails intermittently
with following error:

    Fibre Channel volume device not found

This happens when a zone is created using second or later target nsp
from 3PAR backend. In this case, HPE 3PAR client code picks up first
target nsp to form initiator target map.

To avoid above mentioned failure, user can specify target nsp in 3PAR
backend section of cinder.conf as follows:

    hpe3par_target_nsp = <n:s:p>

This target information is read from cinder.conf and respective
wwn information is fetched. Later initiator target map is created
using wwn information and bootable volume is created successfully.

Change-Id: I2da5d4a0334f07967af5ff7aaa39a0ecc4b12204
Closes-bug: #1809249
Closes-bug: #1812665
Closes-bug: #1734917
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/32/677232/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('hpe3par_target_nsp', default="", help="The nsp of 3PAR backend to be used when: " "(1) multipath is not enabled in cinder.conf. " "(2) Fiber Channel Zone Manager is not used. " "(3) the 3PAR backend is prezoned with this " "specific nsp only. For example if nsp is 2 1 2, the " "format of the option's value is 2:1:2"),

commit_message:
Filter UnsupportedServiceVersion warning

Add the following warning emitted in functional tests
to the filterwarnings.

  UnsupportedServiceVersion: Service placement has no discoverable
  version. The resulting Proxy object will only have direct passthrough
  REST capabilities.

The warning is emitted because there is not a service description
(pairs of a suppoerted version and a proxy class) for placement service
in openstacksdk.
So set the filter until the service description for placement service
is added in openstacksdk.

Change-Id: Ie3d4a122ccfe1a1022e7aa7604585a727489c5be
Closes-Bug: #1838807

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-12 04:10:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/a4cc905019d651c80b2b0dc0a3e0f62b9ea6b7cf', 'message': 'Allow mixing of count and instances

commit_message:
Allow mixing of count and instances

The reason for this change is that users will find managing most
nodes by count much easier, but migrated environments will begin
by having every node as an instances entry. This change allows
them to scale up further by just incrementing the count.

There would be other use cases where only a few nodes need a custom
instances entry, but requiring switching over to instances for every
node would be difficult for large clouds.

This makes the count mandatory as there will always be $count
instances created. If there is also instances entries these will
be created first, then further instance entries are created until
the desired $count is reached.

Change-Id: I52bf5dcf175523dd0998ef2f1d36b6b883259707
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

deleted_lines: # Count makes no sense with instances and thus is disallowed. self.assertIn("Count and instances cannot be provided together", result.error)

commit_message:
Lookup interfaces by MAC directly

Currently the amphora agent will lookup interfaces using the
interface name determined earlier in the plug method. This can
lead to a race condition with the udev interface renaming rule.
This patch changes the interface lookup to use the MAC address
directly and not rely on the interface name.

Story: 2006300
Task: 36013

Change-Id: I5bc21d5abdeb67a3a8ae88456735643463f15694

DNM: Test websockify response

Poor way of seeing what the "normal" response is supposed to be here, to
contrast with [1] (with websockify 0.9.0) where we're getting...
something else.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/677479

commit_message:
DNM: Test websockify 0.9.0

Attempt to reproduce tempest failures using websockify 0.9.0 per [1] and
the related bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008562.html

Change-Id: I4112abffc9856edf8ada8d4d5a2795a8c299d149
Related-Bug: #1840788
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677479

subject: Make expected websock upgrade response more generic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-20 18:15:19.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_novnc.py', 'tempest/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/a345a86d5b91dcecb7110e7749ae14bf276ae065', 'message': "Make expected websock upgrade response more generic

test_novnc was scraping a response for 'server: websockify', which
disappeared between websockify 0.8.0 and 0.9.0. Cut over to looking for
'upgrade: websocket' instead (and remove the config option related to
the 'server: *' value).

Change-Id: Ic2b71ab612c14095ecf35587d7fe420144468c80
Closes-Bug: #1840788
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677479
"}]
commit_message:
Make expected websock upgrade response more generic

test_novnc was scraping a response for 'server: websockify', which
disappeared between websockify 0.8.0 and 0.9.0. Cut over to looking for
'upgrade: websocket' instead (and remove the config option related to
the 'server: *' value).

Change-Id: Ic2b71ab612c14095ecf35587d7fe420144468c80
Closes-Bug: #1840788
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677479
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/33/677533/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rsdlib changed providing_pools interface

With the latest changes in the rsdlib in the RSD driver,
The _get_providing_pool(self, volume) method is returning
StoragePoolCollection instance, instead of StoragePool URL. Made
code changes and corresponding unit tests to address this changes

Change-Id: If7d24d2537deecd28400c120a23f3af172e92222
Closes-Bug: #1836121

added_lines: mock_providing_pool_collection = mock.Mock() mock_providing_pool_collection.path = mock.Mock() mock_providing_pool = mock.Mock() mock_providing_pool.get_members = mock.Mock( return_value=[mock_providing_pool_collection]) mock_volume.capacity_sources[0].providing_pools = [mock_providing_pool] self.assertEqual(mock_providing_pool_collection.path, provider_pool)

subject: Create extras for pypi install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-05-02 04:36:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1f64a1e103223a5a7001597d6f53617a11f0aa5b', 'message': "Create extras for pypi install

This patch adds a new [extras] to setup.cfg.  This section contains
support for drivers and their dependency requirements.  This allows
a user to pip install cinder and optionally install a driver's
required pypi based library.

For example, if you wanted to install cinder and support the 3PAR
driver, you would use:

pip install cinder[hpe3par]

This installs all of the cinder requirements as well as the requirements
for the hpe3par driver.

The following drivers weren't added to the extras stanza
rbd: No rados library in pypi
drbd:  There is no drbdmanage pypi package
linstor: no python-linstor pypi package
storpool:  pypi package doesn't install in python3 env

Change-Id: I2200ce6f554df0c988eb39521ce4defd75998a85
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-05-02 15:12:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/16dd81c7ea61bcb47a3a487b121bf1bd300dbd64', 'message': "Create extras for pypi install

commit_message:
Create extras for pypi install

This patch adds a new [extras] to setup.cfg.  This section contains
support for drivers and their dependency requirements.  This allows
a user to pip install cinder and optionally install a driver's
required pypi based library.

For example, if you wanted to install cinder and support the 3PAR
driver, you would use:

pip install cinder[hpe3par]

This installs all of the cinder requirements as well as the requirements
for the hpe3par driver.

The following drivers weren't added to the extras stanza
rbd: No rados library in pypi
drbd:  There is no drbdmanage pypi package
linstor: no python-linstor pypi package
storpool:  pypi package doesn't install in python3 env

Change-Id: I2200ce6f554df0c988eb39521ce4defd75998a85

commit_message:
ec: log durability of frags that fail to reconstruct

Whether the frag is durable or non-durable greatly affects how much I
care whether I can reconstruct it.

Change-Id: Ie6f46267d4bb567ecc0cc195d1fd7ce55c8cb325
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/08/677608/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: ec_archive_dict[ (md5(body).hexdigest(), next(ts).internal)] = archive_bodies for etag, ts in itertools.cycle(ec_archive_dict): body = ec_archive_dict[(etag, ts)].pop(0) for expected_etag, ts in ec_archive_dict: del ec_archive_dict[(expected_etag, ts)] 'reconstruct 10.0.0.1:1001/sdb/0%s policy#0 ' \ 'frag#1 with ETag' % \ self.obj_path.decode('utf8'))

commit_message:
DVR-Enable ARP Responder when DVR and L2pop is enabled

This patch enables ARP Responder with DVR routers along with
l2pop in devstack.

Related-Bug: #1774459

Change-Id: I82f628c32f6e38c2419b6ffe90d9f9adf96777b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/67/656867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF agent arp_responder True

commit_message:
Add assert statements for Volume Pagination test to get passed

In the endpoint for http and https, Keystone has explicit
port number.

So, added assert statements by using urlparse for parsing the
hostname, path and scheme of the url.

Change-Id: I38d875c36ba72fd49f9e9f6fbd9ca3160f4821a6
Closes-Bug: #1838530

Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so that
CI can remove the job completely.

On master this job has been converted to 15, let's not do this on the
branch.

commit_message:
Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so that
CI can remove the job completely.

On master this job has been converted to 15, let's not do this on the
branch.

Change-Id: I9dd301b5e03b0d40453acbcf3a8c2d7e2232d026
